data.text: Desire not a multitude of unprofitable children,
If they multiply, delight not in them,
Trust not thou in their life,
For from one that hath understanding shall a city be peopled;
Many such things have I seen with mine eyes;
In the congregation of sinners shall a fire be kindled;
He was not pacified toward the giants of old time,
He spared not those with whom Lot sojourned,
He pitied not the people of perdition,
And in like manner the six hundred thousand footmen,
Even if there be one stiffnecked person,
As his mercy is great, so is his correction also:
The sinner shall not escape with his  plunder;
He will make room for every work of mercy;
Verses 15 and 16 are omitted by the best authorities.
Say not thou, I shall be hidden from the Lord;
Behold, the heaven, and the heaven of heavens,
The mountains and the foundations of the earth together
And no heart shall think upon these things:
And there is  a tempest which no man shall see;
Who shall declare the works of his  righteousness?
He that is wanting in Gr. heart.  understanding thinketh upon these things;
My son, hearken unto me, and learn knowledge,
I will shew forth instruction by weight,
In the judgement of the Lord are his works from the beginning;
He garnished his works for ever,
No one thrusteth aside his neighbour;
After this also the Lord looked upon the earth,
Gr. The soul of every living thing.  All manner of living things covered the face thereof;
